intro: Trechonaetes machucana, commonly known as the Machuca tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. The tree's bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
